attributes.action: Make it illegal to keep syrian hamsters in cages smaller than 80×50cm.
attributes.background: Pet shops should be banned from selling cages smaller than 80×50cm for Syrian hamsters & must ask for proof of a suitable cage when selling a hamster. People keeping syrian hamsters in cages smaller than 80×50 should be reported and fined and the hamster rescued. 80×50cm should be the legal minimum.
attributes.additional_details: Syrian hamsters deserve to thrive in the environment we put them in. Syrian hamsters need at least 50×80cm of unbroken floor space to make thier burrows and live happily.  To keep the hamster happy and active the bigger cage the better with the proper size wheel (30cm) and other crucial enrichment. Rodents have just as much worth as bigger family pets and deserve to be treated with the same respect and love.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317070

Rayer’s Petition
A review of the law & incentives to reduce littering in the UK
attributes.background: We are petitioning for more severe penalties for anyone found to be littering/fly tipping. We are also petitioning for a review of the support required to police these illegal activities
attributes.additional_details: We shall further petition for a review of return incentive schemes that will promote the reduction of plastic use & littering. The aim is to reduce litterIng & fly tipping in our environment & to promote the heath of our environment & wildlife.

attributes.action: Allow tattoo studios to reopen from July 6th
attributes.background:
Tattooists and piercers are some of the few professionals who are trained to deal with blood-borne pathogens and cross-contamination on a daily basis. We already have been using PPE and hospital grade cleaning procedures for years. 
We are health and safety regulated by our councils, and licensed.
attributes.additional_details:
We have far more safety regulations already in place than retail stores or hair salons, including regular inspections from the health and safety department.

We feel we are able to offer our clients a far safer environment than any other business.
With this in mind, we urge you to reconsider the delay in reopening, and let us start working from July 6th.

attributes.action: Print car registrations on fast food bags so when littered can get fined
attributes.background: I would like the government to implement mandatory changes to all fast food establishments with a drive through takeaway to legally print the customers driving registration on the products bag so when it is thoughtlessly thrown out as litter it can be returned with a fine to prevent more littering.
attributes.additional_details: I feel it is necessary that the government has their say because without correct enforcement the littering is always going to carry on and even worse than it has before. Our planet suffers enough with pollution so with little steps like this we can all care for the environment more and more as each day passes. The reason for this petition is that through the current crisis we are all in, the environment has benefited tremendously as all the restaurants have been closed, and as they have reopened the problem is slowly but surely creeping it’s way back.

attributes.action: Allow all children to remain in current Academic year in September
attributes.background: Children and teachers will be under extensive pressure to re-learn/ teach previous years curriculum as well as learning new material from new Academic Year. attributes.additional_details: This will be an extra year on nurseries and child care providers, for those children that are due to start school from September. attributes.action: Make it mandatory for solar power to be built and installed on new build houses.
attributes.background: It makes no sense to take away green field sites to install solar power when we are building houses at an astonishing rate. These new solar farms are there to support the new houses so why not install them on the houses and keep the green fields, green.
attributes.additional_details: Housing builders and solar companies must liaise and develop plans to consolidate their actions. The roof will be a hot topic, but the house builders must take a shared responsibility with the solar installers for the production of a guarantee and warranty that protects the home owners should a roofing issue develop. But we need to stop taking from the environment under the illusion we are protecting it. If you want to protect it, build solar sites on roofs.

attributes.action: Replace GDP with a measure that includes human health, happiness and wellbeing
attributes.background: The government should consult on alternative measures of national welfare taking into account non-economic factors including human health and happiness, as well as the health of the environment. A firm commitment should be made to replacing GDP as the sole or main measure of national prosperity.
attributes.additional_details:
Increasing GDP has been the holy grail of governments for centuries but an ever-expanding economy is incompatible with the challenges we face in the 21st century. Policies aimed at increasing GDP have given us the climate emergency, plastic pollution and mass extinctions. We've suffered recessions which have cost livelihoods and lives and seen whole regions passed by in the spoils of growth.

We need a new yardstick to aim for which leads to a more sustainable and happy future for us all.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do, in particular we don't know what you mean by replacing GDP. There is not a single, official measure that the Government use to assess policy impact or the health of the country.

The Office for National Statistics already collects data on a range of areas, you can find more information here: https://www.ons.gov.uk/peoplepopulationandcommunity/wellbeing
                
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do, such as changes to specific policies. For example, you could start a petition requesting a specific strategy for increasing human health, happiness and wellbeing.

attributes.action: Ban fossil fuel powered mopeds and scooters in London due to pollution and noise
attributes.background: Having lived all over London the rise of delivery services has increased noise 24/7 where it's significantly effected my wellbeing from noise and pollution. Currently my new neighbours use 6 mopeds as couriers. Revving at all hours and alarm sounds e.g https://youtu.be/xRz39QtuT9U?t=73.
attributes.additional_details:
Pollution evidence https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/science/science-news/10834679/Scooters-pollute-more-than-lorries.html

Government research "exposure to noise can have significant physical and mental health implications – with heart attacks, high blood pressure, type 2 diabetes and stress all linked to long-term contact with loud environments." - https://www.gov.uk/government/news/new-noise-camera-trial-to-crack-down-on-illegal-vehicles.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the issue you raise is not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament.

This is the responsibility of the Mayor of London and London Assembly. You can petition the London Assembly directly: https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions

We have published the following related petition, which you might like to sign: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318811

attributes.action: Allow the PMU, Hair, Beauty & personal care Industry's to return to work
attributes.background: To allow those of us working in permanent make up, hair & beauty industries to return to work amid the cover-19 crisis with extra safety, hygiene & infection control measures in place. I believe with the correct measures in place we can safely return to work and ensure the containment of covid-919.
attributes.additional_details: As a permanent make up artist, I have always worked in a clean, clinical and hygienic environment. With infection control and cross contamination preventions in place. I wear disposable PPE with every client, which consists of a disposable apron, disposable mask, a hair net, plastic disposable bed covers and of course gloves. All equipment is covered with disposable hygiene protection and the clinic is cleaned with medical grade disinfectants between every single client.

attributes.action: To cancel A level Exams for the class of 2021 or lower the grade boundaries.
attributes.background: I would like to government to take into consideration what the coronavirus pandemic has caused for students who are meant to be taking their A Level exams next year as many are unable to work and concentrate properly at this time as they are not in a classroom environment.
attributes.additional_details: I would like parliament to think about cancelling the exams until a further date maybe adding another college year for students who have struggled to catch up with their learning or lowering the grade boundaries so that many pupils with have fair chance when sitting these important exams with can have a massive impact on their future. It is vital that the government helps these students who are missing out on vital parts of their education due to this pandemic.

attributes.action: Provide subsidies for resources/ tools to support home learning due to COVID-19.
attributes.background:
Provide subsidies to support the delivery of core curriculum and learning activities at home/ remote learning environments.
The grant could cover; pens, pencils, reading books (exercise & folders), printing (paper, ink, prints from Twinkl etc..), art (brushes, paints) and basic science kit.
attributes.additional_details:
As a direct result of COVID-19 and mass school closures across the country, the 'home' has rapidly become the core learning environment for children and young learners.

Access to digital resourcing is welcomed, yet this needs to be carefully balanced to account for the digital wellbeing of learners.

The costs associated with providing basic resources is accruing and is out of reach for many. This is critical to ensure that educational  continuity is provided during this period of uncertainty.

rejection.details:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/313284

attributes.action: Change Sunday trading. Allow time to socialise, exercise & help the environment
attributes.background: I would like the Government to debate Sunday shop opening, with a view to giving families and friends a time where they can socialise. This would need to also include deliveries from online retailers. There are many reasons why this is a good idea, mental health, well-being, environmental and social
attributes.additional_details: I believe that the Covid 19 virus has opened our eyes to a different way forward for our society. It's clear that we don’t need to shop 7 days a week but do need to spend quality time with people we love. Individuals only have a certain amount of money in their banks and they would spend it in 6 days rather than 7. This is a time to understand the value of our planet and the people who live on it. This is not a religious petition, although if it moves forward it may gain church support.

attributes.action: Implement a plan to respect Nature and all its inhabitants including animals.
attributes.background:
It is evident that human society for hundreds of years has been disregarding nature by creating policies that gain us short term economic benefit by robbing the earth of its limited resources and disrespecting all other forms of life on the planet.
Scientific evidence shows we need to change policy
attributes.additional_details:
Government need to find experts in our country and set up a department/Taskforce to consider changes to our policies and attitudes not just to our environment but all forms of life that reside in our environment and see how we can align our way of living so that it is harmonious with nature.
We need to consider bringing in practices for businesses that do not damage the environment but other forms of life, respect for nature is key to  a healthy planet.
Economics with respect for nature.

attributes.action: County Councils to set aside land/space to plant a tree for each COVID-19 victim
attributes.background: Once we have emerged from the COVID-19 pandemic, ask parliament to force county councils to allocate land or space, with government backing, so that a tree can be planted for every person who died in their county as a result of the COVID-19 virus.
attributes.additional_details:
There is no doubt that the current COVID-19 pandemic has changed our lives and will continue to do so for many years.  Each day we are faced with grim news announcing an increasing number of COVID-19 cases and associated deaths, with only the acts of individual and group kindness towards others to punctuate the news.

Let's create forests, woods or areas all over the UK to remember those who have fallen to the virus, to give us somewhere to reflect, enjoy the open air and help our environment.

attributes.action: Postpone all university exams and course work depending on the year of study
attributes.background: We would like the government to allow all university's to post post all final year exams and allow 1st and 2nd years to progress based  on they're grades throughout the study of that year with the option to sit exams at the start of september as an option for students unsatisfied.
attributes.additional_details: This will allow students to have more time to revise as many of us are unable to at home due to covid 19 measures and the home environment can be very distracting and unsuitable. On top of this the way some of us are being taught online is inadequate as we do not all learn the same way. Some are visual some are auditory and some are dexterous meaning if these exams take place it would be very unfair for a lot of students. Another reason is many students don't have the proper facilities at home to revise and prepare for exams and as this is a time that is unprecedented especially with everything going on and worrying about our elders it is unfair to strain us more with exams and course work.

attributes.action: Protect workers from unfair dismissal during COVID-19 for self isolation.
attributes.background: Employees in non essential roles are forced to go to work or lose their jobs during the COVID-19 lock down.  This is unacceptable, employers should be prosecuted for putting people's health at risk, and endangering the public by spreading COVID-19 and not taking steps to protect staff and the public
attributes.additional_details: The government must support those workers as much as he is supporting industry.  People have the right to work in a safe environment without being coerced by managers with fear of being fired if they do not comply. Unethical employers are not making enough adjustments to allow work from home.  We call on the Prime Minister for clarity in this down lock and prosecution of employers not complying. A helpline for workers in such situations for reporting and advice of non-compliance by employers.

attributes.action: COVID 19 special consideration for Year 12/10 students sitting exams 2021
attributes.background: Dispensation for students who are disadvantaged and whose grades/results will be adversely effected by self teaching using online resources which were not designed for that purpose. Students should be given special consideration e.g. using minimum expected grades, lower grade boundaries, coursework.
attributes.additional_details: Students should be given special consideration due to the unprecedented global health crisis and its inevitable long term social and economic impact. Students will be disadvantaged for many reasons; school/college closures, self teaching, no opportunities for work experience, psychological well-being, loss of family/friends due to COVID 19, their own health, minimal support networks, access to home learning resources e.g internet, IT etc, home environment, additional responsibilities during isolation e.g care of siblings/family members, students facing disadvantage will be most vulnerable etc.

rejection.details:
Decisions about exams are a matter for exam boards and individual schools, not the UK Government or Parliament. You can read the decision made by exam boards on what will happen to exams here:
https://www.gov.uk/government/news/further-details-on-exams-and-grades-announced

If you want the Government to review the decision to use previous data to calculate exam grades, you may wish to sign this petition:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/306773

As a result of the large numbers of petitions people have tried to start on this issue, and following a large number of questions it received from petitioners about exams, the Petitions Committee asked the Government about the impact of coronavirus on schools and exams.

Watch all the questions and responses:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MmHWDlzlxfA&feature=youtu.be&t=3771

Watch the responses to the following questions:

attributes.action: Sanction China Until Better Laws for Animals, People and Earth Are Implemented
attributes.background:
In China, dogs are blowtorched, strangled, beaten or even cooked alive for their meat. Cats are also slaughtered horrifically. Bears languish on farms where their bile is taken. Animals are skinned alive.
 Human rights are disgustingly abused and the environment is polluted for profit in China.
attributes.additional_details:
Don’t get me wrong, I love Chinese culture and the Chinese people. I also know that not all Chinese people are bad and do not, in any way, truly support hate against the Chinese people.
 However, animals are sickeningly mistreated in China. Human rights, for instance, those of the Uyghur Muslims, are shockingly abused in China. The air in Beijing is severely polluted.
 The only way that the Chinese Government will ever improve things is if they are heavily pressured monetarily and politically.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want to see sanctions introduced against China, but it's not clear at what point you want these sanctions to be withdrawn.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Petition to bring back John Major for PM.
attributes.background:
The UK Government should draw upon the critical expertise and wise statesmanship of John Major, who exemplifies many personal qualities that may assist in these turbulent times.

John Major was also well received by the Royal family during his tenure and had special connection with them
attributes.additional_details:
The current constitutional crisis may be alleviated by drawing upon many grandee figures, who may provide the vision, experience and fortitude to lead Britain through Brexit and renewed tensions with Russia.

I believe too that the personal relations John Major had with King Charles, Price William and Price Harry may be renewed and amended leading to much harmony.

It is my belief that John Major has the dignity, gravitas and respect to end this hostile media environment.

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions about honours or appointments. 

In any case, as you might already know, the Prime Minister of the UK is not chosen by the UK Government or Parliament.

After a general election, the Queen decides who to invite to form a Government. In practice, this is usually the leader of the political party that wins the most seats in a general election. You can find out more about this here:
https://www.royal.uk/queen-and-government

attributes.action: Put a climate damage score on all foods so consumers can make informed decisions
attributes.background: A third of all climate damage is caused by what we eat whether through deforestation, air miles, or methane emissions. By putting scores on food (like nutritional information) consumers can make a big difference to their carbon footprint by choosing lower scored foods
attributes.additional_details: This is something that individuals can’t do on their own as there is so much we don’t know about our food. For example, one avocado may come from a well established tree, whereas another may come from a source that has had to cut down trees to plant a new avocado tree and so would be a worse choice for the environment. Even if all fossil fuels were stopped tomorrow, the planet will still heat up by 2 degrees by the end of the century if we don’t change how we eat.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want to see new labelling requirements for food, but it's not clear how you want "climate damage scores" to be calculated.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.additional_details:
Students are not taught enough about environmental issues in the modern day yet they are the ones who will have to fix it in the years to come. Awareness for our current situation needs to be prompted in all subjects (not just geography)!!!
